title: Fatima Bhutto: 'Pakistan will welcome the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge with open arms'
text:
The name Bhutto is synonymous with a bygone age, when Western elites and Eastern dynasties mingled in the same jet-setting circles. At Oxford, Benazir Bhutto had been friends with Theresa May, who she introduced to her future husband, Philip.

A chance meeting in 1989 in the royal box on Wimbledon's Centre Court between Princess Diana and Benazir, who was by then Pakistan’s prime minister, led to an invitation - and Diana would make her first solo trip to Pakistan two years after that.

Today, I am meeting Benazir’s niece, Fatima. It is still a few weeks away from when the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge will arrive in Islambad for their five-day tour, which began on Monday, but with a population...
description: The name Bhutto is synonymous with a bygone age, when Western elites and Eastern dynasties mingled in the same jet-setting circles.
